body.text: The webhook you created for for the `attachmentActions` resource instructs Webex to post to your app when a user clicks an `Action.Submit` button. This POST request will include a JSON payload, however, just like other API resources that contain encrypted data, the webhook's body will not include the form submission.

To retrieve the sensitive data, your app will use the `data.id` field from the webhook's JSON payload as part of a [GET /attachment/actions](https://developer.webex.com/docs/api/v1/attachment-actions/create-an-attachment-action) request to retrieve the decrypted attachmentAction, ie:
The `inputs` field provides any card specific data.  Other fields like `personId`, `messageId` and `roomId` let you correlate which user pressed the button on which card, in which Webex Teams space.
